page.title: 12BLAENAVON FARM - TONMAWR
page.content: For over 200 years the Williams Family has been living up at Blaenavon Farm. Olive Williams is a pupil at Tonmawr School; her father was born on the table in the kitchen of the farm. Six people run the farm. They have 15 cows and 7 dogs, 2 horses and 1000 sheep.They have 10 chickens. None of the animals are pets - they all work. They have a hay barn, six stalls,a stable, a shearing shed and a hay bailer. They have 500 acres of land, so they have plenty of land for the sheep to feed on. They grow hay for their own animals. They have just finished shearing and have 13 big bails of wool - each on is about 2 metres by 3 metres. It takes about 2 days to shear all the sheep.
